text: To get your vehicle out of a skid, you should first:

answers.text: Steer in the direction you want to go.
Steer straight ahead
Steer in the opposite direction of the skid.
Apply brakes hard.

explanation: To get your vehicle out of a skid, you should first steer in the direction you want to go.

text: When may you lend your driver's license?

answers.text: It is not permitted.
In emergencies.
To a person learning to drive.
For identification purposes.

explanation: You should not lend your driver’s license.

text: What must a driver do before entering a highway from a private road or driveway?

answers.text: Yield right-of-way to all vehicles approaching on the highway.
Enter or cross the highway as quickly as possible.
Sound horn and proceed with caution.
Give hand signal then take right-of-way.

explanation: Before entering a highway from a private road or driveway a driver must yield right-of-way to all vehicles approaching on the highway.

text: Never change lanes in traffic without:

answers.text: Giving proper signal and looking to make sure the move can be made safely.
Looking in the rear view mirror only.
Blowing your horn and looking to the rear.
Decreasing speed and giving correct signal.

explanation: When changing lanes in traffic always give the proper signal and look to make sure your move can be made safely.

text: When the driver of another vehicle is about to overtake and pass your vehicle, you must:

answers.text: Move to the right and allow such vehicle to pass.
Speed up so that passing is not necessary.
Move to the left to prevent passing.
Signal to the other driver not to pass.

explanation: When the driver of another vehicle is about to overtake and pass your vehicle, you must move to the right and allow his/her vehicle to pass.

text: When you are deciding whether or not to make a U-turn, your first consideration should be to check:

answers.text: Traffic regulations.
Presence of trees, fire hydrants or poles near the curb.
Turning radius of your car.
Height of curb.

explanation: When you are deciding whether or not to make a U-turn, your first consideration should be to check the traffic regulations.

text: It is more dangerous to drive at the maximum speed limit at night than during daytime as:

answers.text: You cannot see as far ahead at night.
Your reaction time is slower at night.
Some drivers unlawfully drive with parking lights only.
The roadways are more apt to be slippery at night.

explanation: It is more dangerous to drive at the maximum speed limit at night than during the daytime because you cannot see as far ahead at night.

text: You should under all conditions drive at a speed which will allow you to:

answers.text: Stop within a safe distance.
Stop within 150 metres (500 feet).
Stop within 90 metres (300 feet).
Stop within 60 metres (200 feet).

explanation: Under all conditions you should drive at a speed that will allow you to stop within a safe distance

text: At what times must a driver accompany you in the front passenger seat if you are driving with a learner's license?

answers.text: At all times
During the hours of darkness
At peak traffic times
On high speed highways

explanation: When you are you are driving with a learner's license, a graduated driver must accompany you in the front passenger seat all the time.

text: In what amount of time must you inform the Ministry of Transportation if a licensed driver changes their name or address?

answers.text: Within 6 days
At any time prior to the license renewal date
Within 28 days
Within 12 days

explanation: When you as a licensed driver change your name or address you must inform the Ministry of Transportation within 6 days.

text: If there is median on the road, when do you need to stop for a school bus?

answers.text: If you are behind it and it has red lights flashing
If you are approaching it
Any time it is stopped
At no time

explanation: If you are behind it and it has red lights flashing.

text: What does having an Accessible Parking Permit do?

answers.text: A vehicle carrying the person to whom it was issued to use a designated disabled parking space
A designated parking space to be used by any vehicle showing the permit
The holder to park anywhere
The holder’s family members to use designated spaces

explanation: A vehicle carrying the person to whom it was issued to use a designated disabled parking space.

text: How much visibility do you need to be able to make a U-turn?

answers.text: 150 metres
125 metres
50 metres
250 metres

explanation: 150 metres.

text: How much authority do signs giving instructions around roadwork have?

answers.text: Legally enforceable
Only applicable to site traffic
Optional
Only applicable to large vehicles

explanation: Legally enforceable.

text: If you fail to stay at the scene of an accident, how many points could you get on your license?
What is the area that you are unable to see in your rear and side-view mirrors?

answers.text: Blind spot
Dark area
Danger zone
Safe zone

explanation: Blind spot.

text: What does over driving your headlights mean?

answers.text: Driving so fast that your stopping distance is farther than you can see with your headlights
Using your headlights when unnecessary
Flashing your headlights constantly
Driving with high beam headlights at all times

explanation: Driving so fast that your stopping distance is farther than you can see with your headlights.

text: What does a red X over a driving lane mean?

answers.text: A driver must not enter or remain in that lane
It applies to pedestrians only
Drivers in that lane must stop immediately
It indicates traffic lights ahead

explanation: A driver must not enter or remain in that lane.

text: If you are exiting a freeway, what should you do?

answers.text: Signal, move into the deceleration lane, reduce speed gradually and obey exit signs
Signal and then stop to wait for an opening in traffic
Do what the vehicle ahead of you does
Signal, and then accelerate while merging smoothly into traffic and then proceed to the exit lane

explanation: Signal, move into the deceleration lane, reduce speed gradually and obey exit signs.

text: If your brakes fail, what should you do?

answers.text: Pump the brakes rapidly and shift into a lower gear
Wave down the nearest police officer and shout for help
Firmly press down on your brakes until they re-engage
Use your emergency brake and sound your horn to warn other drivers while looking for a soft collision point

explanation: Pump the brakes rapidly and shift into a lower gear.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Shows alternative routes for the same destination with their respective timings.
Shows the distance for the mentioned town or city on the road
Shows unpaved routes to the mentioned cities or towns
Shows pedestrian control information

explanation: Emergency response signs are information signs which include a numbering system along the bottom of the sign to assist emergency vehicles and drivers in determining an appropriate route.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Shows on the back of long commercial vehicles usually of 40 m in length
Shows route to the nearest Cargo place
Shows long commercial vehicle parking
Shows that the Long commercial vehicles is prohibited in this road

explanation: This placard identifies a long commercial vehicle, which is a double trailer and can be up to 40 metres in length.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: These are bilingual signs conveying messages like No standing, School bus turning
These are for driving instructions
Shows only Construction zone related information
These are for directing drivers to off-road facilities

explanation: Watch for bilingual signs when driving in designated bilingual areas. Read the messages in the language you understand best.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Shows slow-moving vehicle usually under 40 km/h
Shows fast-moving vehicle usually above 40 km/h
Shows Long commercial vehicle usually of 40 meter in length
Shows stopped vehicle within the road

explanation: The slow-moving vehicle sign is an orange triangle with a red border. It alerts other drivers that the vehicle ahead will be traveling at 40 km/h or less.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Shows alternative routes to drivers during unscheduled closure of provincial highway
Shows direction to the cities or towns
Shows speed limit in the provincial highway
Shows traffic control information

explanation: Emergency Detour Route signs are used during the unscheduled closure of a provincial highway when Ontario Provincial Police detour all traffic off the highway.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Reserved lane for public vehicle like buses or car carrying mentioned passengers count
Restricted lane for passenger vehicles
High speed lane
Reserved lane for ambulance

explanation: When a High Occupancy Vehicle (HOV) signs, only public vehicles such as buses, or passenger vehicles carrying a specified minimum number of passengers, may use this lane.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Vehicles cannot change lanes into or out in the area between these signs
Vehicles can change lanes into or out in the area ahead
Restricted lane for pedestrians
Lane specific for Bicycles

explanation: Vehicles cannot change lanes into or out of a high-occupancy vehicle lane in this area.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: No pedestrian allowed in this road
No vehicles allowed in this road
No bicycles allowed in this road
No crosswalk in the area ahead

explanation: A regulatory sign indicates pedestrians are not allowed on this road.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Parking for vehicles having accessible parking permit
Parking is prohibited in this area
Ambulance parking area
Parking prohibited for disabled persons

explanation: A regulatory sign showing a parking space is only for vehicles displaying a valid Accessible Parking Permit.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Drivers must keep right of the traffic island
Drivers must keep left of the traffic island
Drivers must take the left turn
Drivers must take the right turn

explanation: A regulatory sign for when you must keep to the right of the traffic island.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Zone where school buses load or unload students without signaling
School Zone ahead
Bus Stop ahead
There is a Parking for school buses only

explanation: A regulatory which marks a zone within which school buses load or unload passengers without using the red alternating lights and stop arm.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Drivers must not take right turn when facing red light at intersection
Drivers must take right turn when facing red light at intersection
Drivers can go straight when facing a red light at intersection
Drivers must come to a complete stop when facing red light at intersection

explanation: Drivers must not take right turn when facing red light at intersection.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Drivers can only park their vehicle during the mentioned time
Drivers can only park their vehicles during other than the time mentioned
Drivers cannot park their vehicles in this area
This is a private parking area

explanation: Drivers can only park their vehicle during the mentioned time.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Drivers must not take left turn during the time mentioned
Drivers must take left turn during the time mentioned
Drivers must take left turn other than the time mentioned
Drivers must not take left turn other than the time mentioned

explanation: Drivers must not take left turn during the time mentioned.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: There is a community zone ahead : Special risk of pedestrians in the area
There is a construction zone ahead : Special risk of workers in the area
There is Hospital zone ahead : Special risk of patients in the area
There is police station ahead : Specials risk of pedestrians in the area

explanation: There is a community zone ahead ; Special risk of pedestrians in the area.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: There is a speed limit in the area ahead when lights are flashing
The 40km/hr is the lowest maximum speed limit in the area ahead when flashing
The flashing indicates the oncoming of train in the railway crossing the road ahead
There is a speed limit in the area ahead when lights are not flashing

explanation: There is a speed limit in the area ahead when lights are flashing.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Drivers cannot park in the area between these signs
Drivers must not stop their vehicle in the area between these signs
Drivers can park their vehicles in the area between these signs
Bicycles can only park in the area between these signs, not four wheel vehicles

explanation: Drivers cannot park in the area between these signs.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: There is a speed limit of 50 km/hr in the area ahead
Ending of a Speed limit zone
There is a speed limit for longer vehicles usually 40m in length
Drivers must keep their vehicles speed above 50 km/hr in the area ahead

explanation: There is a speed limit of 50 km/hr in the area ahead.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Driver on 1st lane must turn left, on 2nd lane must turn left or go straight, on 3rd lane must turn right
Driver on 1st lane must go straight, on 2nd lane must turn right, on 3rd lane must turn left
Driver on 1st lane must turn right, on 2nd lane must turn left, on 3rd lane must go straight
Driver on 1st lane must go straight or turn right, on 2nd lane must turn right, on 3rd lane must turn left

explanation: Driver on 1st lane must turn left, on 2nd lane must turn left or go straight, on 3rd lane must turn right.

text: What does this sign mean?

answers.text: Any vehicle contain hazardous substances or toxins is permitted in this road
Any vehicle contain hazardous substances or toxins is prohibited in this road
There is permit of passing other vehicles in this road
Drivers must not drive on the left lane

explanation: Any vehicle contain hazardous substances or toxins is permitted in this road.
